website_summaries.verdict: A nice-looking stove that is easy to use, but be sure to remove the canister when not in use to avoid butane leaks.
pros: Construction includes a porcelain-coated grate and an aluminum burner
Base can fit up to a 10-inch pan
Has an adjustable burner, Instastart ignition, and wind baffles
Can boil 4 cups of water in 5 minutes
Stove is easy to fuel and use
cons: Quality issues in some of these include ignition breaks and dents or cracks that easily form
Remove canister when not using to avoid leaks

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Boil 4 cups of water in 5 minutes on high using only 0.5 oz of fuel.
customer_reviews.author: G. Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Cook anywhere
customer_reviews.text: Good price for a name branded butane stove. Works well. Word of caution, when you are finished using stove, unlock and remove the canister! Unlocking only allowed a leak in mine.
customer_reviews.author: P. Miller

customer_reviews.title: A Music Festival Necessity
customer_reviews.text: I used this at two music festivals last year and it was awesome. One of the best festival items I have bought in awhile. Also the butane cans last quite awhile. I probably did not even get one of my canisters half gone, using it for 5-6 total meals.
customer_reviews.author: J Lew

customer_reviews.title: They worked great!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 3 of these stoves for a breakfast at work. They worked great!!! The flame is adjustable and there was no odor from using the butane. Each one came in a nice plastic case which makes it great for storage. Definitely a great on these. I would recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: nicely priced portable stove
customer_reviews.text: I took this to a picnic where there weren't any stoves or cooktops. It's perfect for heating up beans or cooking anything. It's small and comes in its own carrying case. It lights up easily and gets plenty hot.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Burner melted with first use
customer_reviews.text: I saw reviews about the burner melting and thought the chances would be slim I would receive one with that issue. Unfortunately mine had the same issue and when the burner melts it’s not just an aesthetic issue. The burner will stop working on that side so the flame will be uneven.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy, lightweight materials; cheaply made; parts fit together poorly; screws not seated squarely or fully. Sits unsteadily on a flat, level surface: rocks back and forth on its feet. Smelled badly of cheap plastic and uncured paint when unpacked, and will sit outside in the sun for a few days to hopefully clear up the stench. Don't be fooled by the brand name: this is cheap Chinese junk, not the quality Coleman product of old. Haven't used it yet, but if it doesn't burn as it should it'll be returned.
customer_reviews.author: deepwater

customer_reviews.title: Super cheap and melted!
customer_reviews.text: Used two times to heat water, and the burner melted.
customer_reviews.author: Dave V.

customer_reviews.title: Buy another brand
customer_reviews.text: Like a good consumer--I opened this up. Connected it to the butane. It worked great! Perfecto! I knew I was ready for the inevitable power outages we get around here. Fast forward 2 years. Opened it up, connected it. NOTHING! Changed butane tanks , nada. Won't buy from this supplier. Won't buy a coleman stove again. (seems like quality has gone way down) Be aware of this if you decide to go with this stove.
customer_reviews.author: Starry Night

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Stove.
customer_reviews.text: I am elderly and live in the basement apt of my son's house. I have to go up stairs to use the main kitchen which is difficult for me. So I decided it would be convenient to assemble a kitchen of sorts in the basement. This stove, a microwave and a small refrigerator. And this one burner Coleman does everything I need. It is compact, portable and easy to use. And spares me being overwhelmed by my 5 grandchildren, who can be a raucous bunch at times. Even though I would not want it any other way. The Coleman is a well designed little stove and great for camping as well.
customer_reviews.author: M. Kadinger

customer_reviews.title: Worst than expected
customer_reviews.text: I had low expectations given price point but this stove managed to be worse. Very cheaply and poorly constructed where screws are loose and not bolted in. The plastic case it came in was already cracked as other reviewers have noted. Worse, the burner melted after one use. Invest in something higher quality. Thankfully, I was able to return this.
customer_reviews.author: Blueberrytoys

customer_reviews.title: Only good for one use and broke
customer_reviews.text: Only worked once. Second time I tried to use it, it would not light. I tried a new fuel cartridge and tried a match. After following the instructions and making more than 20 attempts, I have decided it’s a piece of trash. It’s lightweight and very compact, very disappointing that it won’t work!
customer_reviews.author: Kitty

customer_reviews.title: My stove was out of spec, and would not even accept a fuel cylinder
customer_reviews.text: I have owned a "Mr. Stove" butane burner for years, and purchased this unit as a backup. It would not take a fuel cylinder properly, no matter how many attempts I made to fit one. It appears to be a flaw in the assembly. For $20 I don't care to risk lighting myself or my loved ones on fire. =D Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Casde broken on arrival, twice!
customer_reviews.text: I've long been a Coleman user from white gas & mantle lanterns, to pump stove. So ordered this. It arrived with a broken case; OK could be just that trip through the UPS delivery. Returned it and ordered another. Same problem. Two strikes and you're out. Never got to use the stove itself, bought a competing brand.
customer_reviews.author: JBC

customer_reviews.title: very impressed.
customer_reviews.text: I just received this item today and I have already cooked my first meal with it, mac-n-cheese w/chili...mmmmmmm. I was able to boil 6 cups of water on low in under 6 minutes. sure this thing is lightweight and kinda' thin in areas but that's ok as I don't plan on throwing it around. I purchased this burner/stove for one reason really, for hurricane preparedness, as I live in Florida. I wont be cooking a four course meal with it but it will be perfect for quick meals or boiling water for coffee. so yeah, I'm happy with my purchase and you will be as well.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this single burner to use at football tailgates in the mornings for cooking up bacon, eggs, pancakes, and other things that weren't practical to fire up a grill for. Very pleased with the heat output and how long (and inexpensive) the propane canisters lasted. 2nd time i used it had fellow tailgaters come over and ask questions and take pictures of it so they could go buy one. The ONLY minor negative is that one of the days it was a little breezy, and i had to make an impromptu wind block to get the full effect of the flame, but it wasn't a real issue. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: Broke after one use...
customer_reviews.text: The starter wire broke off after one use. Look elsewhere for a camping stove.
customer_reviews.author: Waz

customer_reviews.title: Warm/Hot meals during power outages !!
customer_reviews.text: I reviewed this product before buying on Youtube! I wanted something easy to use! Locks when butane container is placed in side pocket. Butane fuel cans have slot on can to help make sure butane is attached properly ! During outage I can use to make hot beverages, cook hot meals ! I wanted to start off with one. Then purchase another. Someone posted a photo that the brand GAS ONE the red "butane" cans also go with this Coleman camp stove. Coleman butane in white can are expensive . 4 canisters of GAS ONE were $13.00. Which in emergency situations go to know what alternatives are out there!
customer_reviews.author: b. barns

customer_reviews.title: Coleman stove disappoints.
customer_reviews.text: Just received. Protective carrying case has 4 large cracks. Not great case. The unit butane compartment door will not stay in place and does not shut flush. If you pick up it swings open. I chose Coleman over less expensive stoves because of brand loyalty. I’m not impressed. I’m almost wondering if this was a return. Butane order hasn’t yet arrived so I cannot comment on burn quality. However,I would want the butane door to stay closed.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Great stove, great design!
customer_reviews.text: I like this stove a lot! It heats foods fast and boils water very quickly! The design is great, its light, and attractive to look at.. easy to use and basically unlimited on pot/pan size. The only thing really I don't like, is the metal. Its very thin, and deforms very easily. When I got mine, the metal doorway where the fuel can is stowed...was bent up and didn't close properly. I just used some pliers to straighten it and its fine now. Over all I really do like this stove. I have been testing various camp stoves and so far...this one rocks!
customer_reviews.author: Lumpy14470

customer_reviews.title: Useful for camping & outages
customer_reviews.text: A California must have with all the "scheduled" outages. My stove/oven has a safety feature that locks it up on an outage that can be turned on only with power. I need this to brew coffee at least, or else, no one will be safe around me 😂
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stop working after one use. Not like other coleman product
customer_reviews.text: It worked fine for the first use. I tried to use it second time and it won’t start. I could see the spark and tried different gas bottles. None worked. I bought it because it is from Coleman, but it failed.
customer_reviews.author: J. Choo

customer_reviews.title: Not for K-BBQ or Stir frying cooking
customer_reviews.text: It’s okay. I bought this with the intention of using it as a tabletop stove for Korean BBQ or doing quick stir fry cooking. I think the fire power is too weak to do either.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great burner!
customer_reviews.text: Tested product upon arrival. Bought some butane from Walmart, around 2 bucks a can. I have nothing but great stuff to say about this burner, especially considering the price. This is so easy to use, insert can then just turn the knob all the way and it lights! No need for a lighter thanks to the piezoelectric starter! It has a great flame and produces wonderful even heat. The construction seems solid for the price point. The size is just right for a variety of pots and pans. The case is not molded that well and a bit flimsy but serves its purpose. I purchased this for emergency use when the power goes out.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: As expected, but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: It's a fire, and it heats the pot. These can get very hot. The bigger problem comes with trying to get low enough and still keep the flame lit. An easy breeze blows it out. A wind guard would be a wise choice to use with this and that's probably the route I'll go. Tip: be sure the butane can is aligned properly (twist in a circular direction) or otherwise the butane sprays out at you as you try to lock the can in place. It's obvious after you mess it up the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Shockster

customer_reviews.title: Broken box
customer_reviews.text: Stove arrived in good shape but the storage case it came with was broken upon arrival. Shipping box was not damaged so the storage box was broken prior to being shipped. Very disappointed! Haven’t had a chance to test out the stove to see if it is damaged as well. Once I get my order of butane I will try it out.
customer_reviews.author: Myriam Castrillon

customer_reviews.title: Light-weight, easy to use camp stove!
customer_reviews.text: At first I was hesitant because some of the 1 star reviews said it would burn the surface you use it on. We have used ours for a 2 week camping trip & it didn’t burn our plastic table cloth at all. This camp stove is light weight, easy to travel with (nice carrying case comes with) & does an excellent job cooking food. You have to buy butane tanks separately (but each tank lasts about 3 meals, in our experience). We are even considering buying another one to make our meals go quicker when we are making multiple items. Overall, totally recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Brielle Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Won't work in colder (30 degree) temperatures, but otherwise a great stove!!
customer_reviews.text: The big reason I only gave this stove a 3-star rating was because it will not work in colder temperatures - but that's the nature of butane, not the stove. The stove itself is compact and easy to use!!! It lights quickly and puts out great heat. I've used it to brew coffee during a power outage without any problems. I bought this stove to take to the RC airfield and make coffee. IN warmer weather, it works like a charm. When the temperatures dip to 30 degrees, it won't stay lit. Otherwise, it's a great little stove and easier to transport than my larger Coleman 2-burner.
customer_reviews.author: Steven A. Harness

customer_reviews.title: Gas leak issue, don't leave canister in overnight
customer_reviews.text: We used this for the first time on a camping trip a few months ago, and loved it. We already had a similar model gas stove from Coleman but a different color, and used them side by side. The other model, a gray Coleman stove had seen more use and didn't heat up as fast as this blue one, so there might be longevity issues with this model. It is, however, really inexpensive. Also, we left the canister in overnight in the unlocked position and found that the gas was leaking the next morning, so I absolutely would not recommend leaving that in except while it's in use.
customer_reviews.author: R. R.

customer_reviews.title: One use and done!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to take camping. Worked great at home when we tested it out. Used it ONCE to cook pancakes for breakfast. Afterwards, I noticed the burner part had melted. It’s a camping stove so I should get more than one camping experience with it. Expensive pancakes
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Case Cracked straight from Box
customer_reviews.text: Once I opened the cardboard box and retrieved the case that the stove was in, I excitedly checked out the case. Well, as seen from the photos there was a nice-sized crack on the left side of case. I am highly disappointed as I bought this for a coworker for Secret Santa; now I need to return and, hopefully, exchange it for an undamaged product. How embarrassing is that? Please give me a product that is not defective. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: D. Maciel de Souza

customer_reviews.title: Works well, nice quality
customer_reviews.text: Serves its purpose well. I've only used it once but it does it's job, the only thing is you need to make sure to put the butane in right or it won't lock. So just double check its sitting in there right before going to lock it. The blue color is super cute too! I tested water, soup, and oatmeal on this and it cooked them all pretty quickly without using a ton of butane. It's not a stove to take backpacking or anything but it works great for car camping because its relatively small and flat.
customer_reviews.author: Alyson Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Love My Single Burner Butane Camp Stove!
customer_reviews.text: This camp stove is perfect for cooking at your campsite! I used it to boil water for my coffee and make food for 4 days and loved it. Heats up fast and lights quickly, so the food cooked quicker than I anticipated. I cooked with small versions of pots and pans from Home Goods. Make sure you insert the butane canister correctly (you can buy the canister @ Walmart for about $3 each). Comes with a plastic carrying case as well. Very happy with my single burner camp stove!
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for, butane cylinder wouldn't stay put
customer_reviews.text: The mechanism that secures the butane cylinder to an "active" position is absolute junk. Several times it would simply pop loose, resulting in a loss of fire. I managed to wedge something behind it, which helped to keep it in the forward position, but anything stronger than a stern look at it would otherwise cause the spring to click back. That said, the heat coming off this thing is intense. Even at medium to low, it put off some serious heat.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.C

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Stove For This Solo Camper!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this stove! So EASY to use! I have used it for 1.5 weeks of camping so far, cooking both dinner and breakfast on it. Food/Water heats up very fast even with the flame on low. If I needed a two-burner stove, I would just buy another one of these. By the way, one fuel can lasted me 1.5 weeks cooking 2 meals a day. I am extremely happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly E.

customer_reviews.title: Right Size
customer_reviews.text: Bought this mostly if my electric goes out, I'm in hurricane ally, so tried it to see, SO easy to use, the butane can, the lever down and then the knob turned all the way, then adjust the flame. I tried this on my kitchen counter with a cookie sheet under it for security, worked perfectly well, good purchase. I am a 70 year old Grandmom, so if I can do it so can you.
customer_reviews.author: G. O.

customer_reviews.title: You know you want the Coleman version of this stove.
customer_reviews.text: These stoves are everywhere nowadays, and with good reason. They are a darn fine way to cook, with real adjustability, cheap fuel, and easy storage and handling. When I was shopping for a second one, I saw this Coleman version and I knew I had to have it. It's well made from decent thickness sheet metal. It's a nice color, and comes in a good quality plastic storage case. The butane cylinder can be stored in the stove when in the case. The stove is less than twenty bucks and lights first time, every time. My only complaint would be that it's sometimes hard to see the flame on a bright day.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Rosenfeld

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little stove.
customer_reviews.text: Yeah its a little bulky and not made with the thickest of materials, but this is a really nice stove. We use this when kayaking, camping, and boating. It has been in the water, underwater, in rain and continues to preform. Shake the water out and keep on cooking. For the price you really cant go wrong. We ditched the bulky case and just toss this on the kayaks and go. A can of butane mixture lasts a good while. We go for 2-3 days at a time and bring two cans with extra at the end of the trip. Great little stove at a great price point.
customer_reviews.author: Toby Wright

customer_reviews.title: Great stove but not for freezing weather!
customer_reviews.text: Great stove but not for freezing weather. Works good above 20 to 25 degrees F. Tried using it temps below 20 degrees during ice fishing and couldn't turn on the stove. Seems the butane froze in the entry point. Had to put in warm shack to thaw put before could use again. Will have to use my propane coleman for frigid cold weather. Otherwise, this is a great compact stove. Could use higher heat as it does start off slow. But once the pan is hot and cooking, it works great! Cant wait to use this stove during camping in spring and summer months!
customer_reviews.author: BluYota

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and good quality
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Also the packaging it comes in with a hard box is very helpful to put it around it to stop the wind. The only thing I wished that it came with a pipe that would fit any cylinder not just it’s specific one. I ordered similar to this but a different brand which was cheaper and it came with an extra pipe for other cylinder but quality was poor. This is pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: bily hbk

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturer needs to protect the case.
customer_reviews.text: Without protection between the stove and case, I can't see any of these surviving through shipping. Wake up Coleman. Second of all the spark igniter did not work on the stove, sat far lower than required (covered in the manual). I had to disassemble the burner assembly, loosen the screw holding the spark igniter and raise it up, reassemble. Works fine now. Unit seems to work fine, and for the money will work as part of my preparedness plan.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use. I was very nervous to take this camping as my only previous experience was with a coleman stove from the early 90s where you needed the separate canister sticking off the side and had to use matches or a lighter and it was complicated and cumbersome. This however was a breeze. The canister is hidden inside and there's an igniter included in the mechanism. Just like a real stove, this was easy to use. It is fabulously light and comes in a nice case for safe storage.
customer_reviews.author: Kirstin Conklin

customer_reviews.title: Spewed gas and didn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Spewed gas upon first use - fire hazard - would not work.
customer_reviews.author: Jster

customer_reviews.title: Great stove!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little leery at first buying a stove that was only $20 but knew that I could return the stove if not satisfied. We have had and will continue to have power outages in California so this was something I would be using for a long time. The stove is GREAT, easy to use and light weight. I let a neighbor use mine and she was surprised how quickly she could cook her food. She purchased the same one just a couple days later. I have told other neighbors about this great, lightweight, easy to use, stove!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Holy grail for the at-home Kbbq and Shabu fanatics!
customer_reviews.text: I honestly LIVE for this product. When quarantine struck, I bought this because of how much I missed Kbbq and Shabu. Since then, I find it hard to go back to the restaurants since I can eat it at home. I adore this thing so much and it has worked extremely well in the last 6 months. Wholly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Alizen

customer_reviews.title: Not so good
customer_reviews.text: Finally I used this product. It works great but not stable. It is not balanced. When I use it , I have to stick some support on one of its legs. Quality control needs to be improved.
customer_reviews.author: wenting zhuang

customer_reviews.title: Light but powerful.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a camping trip to the Mountains. Never used a camp stove before and this was easy to set up and use. Very light, comes in its own case so that's helpful. The stove itself is very light, could be used for backpacking. It uses small butane cans that last a long time. Super easy to connect the cans, just push them in and then flick a switch to lock them in and you're good to go. Boiled water quickly for coffee. Used cast iron pan to cook steak and it was just like being at home with a gas range. Great little grill for the price.
customer_reviews.author: R.L. Stine

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought the stove for emergencies pending PG&E power outages. Of course Coleman products are always high quality. I particularly like the case it comes in.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene Sanders

customer_reviews.title: was damaged
customer_reviews.text: just seemed like it was dropped...slightly twisted. works but I just threw it in a Goodwill box cause I was on road and didn't have room for it.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Used during Hurricane Irma. Very easy to use & cook with.
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this for Hurricane Irma last week and it saved the day when we lost power. We were able to make coffee in the mornings and hot dogs for lunch. Very easy to use and cook with.
customer_reviews.author: Angel A. Acevedo

customer_reviews.title: Propane not easy to find
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be a great purchase for us for when we are camping, well I cant seem to find the propane that I need, they don't even sell it here on Amazon. Take type B Propane/Butane.
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne Darling

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and efficient
customer_reviews.text: I travel over the road with my hubby in his truck. This is what I use as my main source of cooking and I love it. The butane is affordable and easy to find in truck stops. With my frying pan and pot there isn’t anything I can not cook that I would normally cook on my stove top. Affordable and efficient. I would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Taye

customer_reviews.title: Stove is great. Shipping handling sucks.
customer_reviews.text: The stove itself is awesome for campers with limited space. The only issue was the storage case it comes with was cracked on the top rendering it non-water resistant. The box it was delivered in looked like it was delivered from a space shuttle with a brick for a parachute. Oh well! I'll not return it because I can apply some pliable silicone or something on the cracked case. Love the stove very much and would recommend. Mick
customer_reviews.author: Mick

customer_reviews.title: Really sturdy, most have for trekking.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my road trip to Canada, and we used this extensively over 11 days (only took take out food probably 5 times are less). Made full meals on this single stove (Indian style). Worked without any issues even at freezing temperatures. I recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Gaurav Katoch

customer_reviews.title: Best lightweight stove you can get
customer_reviews.text: Don't let other expensive brands fool you, this thing is all you need. One burner, extremely high quality, and extremely easy to use. Requires NO batteries or anything of that nature, just put in your fuel and you're good to go. The burner burns real hot and from the past trip I was on, burns efficiently as well.
customer_reviews.author: Roman Somogy

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Adjusting temperature is difficult. Seems pretty hot even on low so definitely can't simmer. Wish the burner would lift off for cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seems good but haven’t been able to use it...
customer_reviews.text: Made out of all steel so it can only be so light but seems stable but I ordered this when we were going to have a hurricane but unfortunately it arrived even with prime a week after it I was very disappointed especially since I lost power for 3 days and no cell phone service and everything. Couldn’t even cook because I didn’t have what I ordered in plenty of time.
customer_reviews.author: wolfgurl

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I primarily use the stove when I car camp. It is lightweight and compact. The stove ignites when I turn on the knob so I'm don't have to find a match or lighter. The first time I packed it away I left the butane canister in the compartment. When I got into my vehicle there was a strange smell. The butane canister had come unlocked and must have been bumping into the valve enough to release butane. Lesson learned, always take the butane canister out and carry separately.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little stove! Extremely impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I'm extremely impressed by this single Coleman butane burner! Being able to adjust the temperature made cooking easy. I love the size of it.. not too big & not too small. It also comes with a carrying case! I couldn't be happier with this unit! I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: John Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I just wanted something for when the power goes out and this is a good model with good reviews at a good price. It even has a carrying case, so all you need is a can of butane (8oz.can should be good for three hours cook time) and you can easily cook a skillet meal or heat up water with the kettle. It is lightweight and seems to be the same size as the burner on my gas stove but they do not recommend a pot bigger than ten inches, that is fine with me.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Grace

customer_reviews.title: Works great, and very portable.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mom who is elderly. She has no problems using it, and she really likes it. She uses it when PG&E cuts power off for “Wind Events” in her area. She is uses it to make coffee and maybe some soup. The stove does use a weird butane container that looks like a spray paint can. I’ve never seen those before until I got this one. In my area of Northern California the butane can are easy to find. Maybe check your local area to make sure you can find the butane cans before you buy.
customer_reviews.author: bryan2103

customer_reviews.title: Solid single burning unit
customer_reviews.text: I've used it for some camping stews , chilli and water boiling for coffee and oatmeal. Coleman really got this right heats my cast iron skillet well. 1 butane can last you about two ready to eat canned soups ,Coffee throughout morning and a mid afternoon omelette or make brunch pancakes bacon works great easy to use and ignite butane. I live this unit
customer_reviews.author: Allon Shabazz

customer_reviews.title: Quickly heated our chili to boiling!
customer_reviews.text: We had a pretty windy day at our tailgate. I purchased this because we knew we had so many things to warm, and not enough grill space. This was the perfect solution. And it worked wonderfully! Heated up quickly and stayed lit even with some gusty winds. We did build some walls around it to lessen the wind. But it was a great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Bevwash

customer_reviews.title: A must have for anyone how works outdoors
customer_reviews.text: This cook top is light weight portable and amazing ! I use daily at work to cook quality hot lunches and dinner out in the field . It truly gets the job done . No more cold lunches for me . Perfect alternative to a truck microwave which honestly just has to much need for power and drains down the battery . Warmed my meal up in a about 3 minutes flat . Totally satisfied 😉😉🤓
customer_reviews.author: Jackgabe

customer_reviews.title: Coleman Quality
customer_reviews.text: Previously had one of these that we got at the asian supermarket. Some no name brand for twice the price that broke after a few weeks. The Coleman looks the same, but it's put together better and hasn't given us a single problem. I plan on buying 1 or 2 more so we can take them camping.
customer_reviews.author: C. Sperling

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Easy to use, works great!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! We've had it almost 3 years. Have used it a few times. Not a lot, but enough to know it works great. Easy to use, the case keeps it clean and dry, boils water fast. No complaints from me!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Just what I expected!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this stove for my very first overnight camping. I needed this for my morning coffee, mainly to boil the water. I got the fuel from Sportsman shop for $2.50 - not the Coleman brand, just one bottle since I thought if it didn't work I won't loose much. The setup is so easy, anybody can do it! I had my own stainless steel pot and I was super happy to get up and make my coffee! Later I used it for making oatmeal and heat up the meal I had in my cooler. I am super happy with this little stove!!! Another plus is the light weight and a case to carry easily.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Easy Butane stove - Carrying Case defective
customer_reviews.text: I like the Coleman Butane Stove, it lights easily and the flame is somewhat adjustable - fuel does not last as long as I'd expect, but is worth the convenience versus other type stoves. One complaint is the carrying case came with a crack in the case, but supplier or amazon site does not provide me with the option to state the case came broken or make a complaint. I do not wish to return all of the unit, but would like a replacement case.
customer_reviews.author: KAL

customer_reviews.title: Overall great stove but they could have made it slimmer for transport
customer_reviews.text: I have owned a few of these stoves and typically the top can be removed and flipped so it can be slimmer for storage. This also allows it to be removed for easy cleaning. I am not sure why the coleman is not removable. You can see that it has some tabs underneath and bent to make it "permanent". I bought this as a camp stove and i wish it could have been a tad thinner for transport/storage. Other than that, it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Dong Tran

customer_reviews.title: Perfect one burner stove.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a few months ago and used it on a camping trip in the Colorado Rockies this week. Small lightweight and efficient. Cooked five meals for two at 9,000 ft altitude and still have gas in the first cartridge. Heats up and cools off quickly. May want to but two or three to feed larger groups but for one or two people this is ideal and no more dealing with liquid fuel..
customer_reviews.author: William Angel

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item and never ended up using it. In less than a year and it DID NOT light up at all. I wish I could exchange or return item...😒😒
customer_reviews.author: Noren

customer_reviews.title: Great Backup Stove
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so that I could have a burner during my kitchen remodel. I used it to heat a tea kettle and to make my daily oatmeal. it is a great little burner that served me well. It lit every time without fail and quickly heats whatever is on it. I will use it in the wintertime at the table to make sukiyaki and shabu-shabu. It's a great table-top burner.
customer_reviews.author: Pgh Shopper

customer_reviews.title: FIRE Hazard
customer_reviews.text: I have multiple brands and types of camping stoves and never had a problem. This stove COMPLETELY CAUGHT FIRE and we had to grab a fire extinguisher to stop it from taking out the whole campground. I had not even put a pan on it. It was not on high, the stove itself just caught fire. It is a very cheap stove that is made cheap. If you buy it make sure you pack around a fire extinguisher too!
customer_reviews.author: SDF

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Little Stove
customer_reviews.text: Came in handy when we lost power in the most recent hurricane. This stove uses small cans of butane to run and in two days without power we didn't even use one full can. The stove comes with a nice carrying case and is compact. This stove can be used inside or outside and would be great for camping.
customer_reviews.author: ECM

customer_reviews.title: Super Simple to use
customer_reviews.text: I am very apprehensive using anything gas, propane, etc. Bad experience as a kid with a gas stove blowing up from a gas buildup in oven, so when it was lit it there was a small explosion. Couldn't even light a match until I was 30 years old. Camping and cooking just over a wood fire or charcoal is just too cumbersome. I thought I would try this out and OMG how easy. Just pop the butane can in and turn the knob and it turns on instantly with no little popping or flare.
customer_reviews.author: rozzbin

customer_reviews.title: Great little stove.
customer_reviews.text: Great little stove that is simple to use, bought it as a last minute addition for my families first camping trip together. We cooked mac-n-cheese on it and it barely used any of the butane can. This will come in handy on future camping trips and in case of a power outage at the house, for the low cost just about everyone should own one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Kev

customer_reviews.title: Great portable stove
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit so I can percolate coffee when I am camping with no amenities. The unit looks good and seems high quality. I love the hard plastic carry case. I am very concerned about 8.8 oz butane cylinder costs. Other reviews say you can perc about 5 pots of coffee on one cylinder. I have to find a low cost source for those cylinders. Coleman cylinders are > $15 per cylinder. Not cost efficient. But, I do love the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Atkison

customer_reviews.title: Compact, Works great, Easy
customer_reviews.text: Having never used butane cans I was a little concerned about how long they would last. But this stove gets hot fast and I usually was done cooking in so short a time that the butane cans are economical. Just follow the instructions printed on the stove itself. No match necessary. Lightly built but that's all it really needs to be.
customer_reviews.author: HMG

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: The stove actually works well. The flame is great and well focused. I also really like the knob, it feel sturdy and nice to turn. I feel like this stove will last a while and its case is pretty solid too. The only part that is a bit off is the cover for the butane canister. It doesnt stay closed very well and flops open sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: V. Shapiro

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: This is now permanent part of my car camping kit. So super-easy to use! I keep the butane can in the stove and the stove in the included plastic case, so it is compact and light. I set the lever to disconnect the butane can so the system is not pressurized when stored in the case. The ignition system works every-time. I use it only to heat water in a kettle for different uses: coffee, hot water, oatmeal. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: El Dude

customer_reviews.title: This little stove is very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This little stove is very easy to use. We took it camping with us, and it served it's purpose well
customer_reviews.author: Karen W

customer_reviews.title: Every campsite or bug out bag should have one..or two!
customer_reviews.text: it is perfect! quick and easy. while everyone is worried about the large grill and stoking a fire.. in seconds I had a pot boiling and when I wanted a quick lunch I was able to make a grilled cheese in minutes with NO Fuss!! Buy it and you will find many reasons to have it. Hot days and emergencies!!!
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: BURNER MELTING after using it 7-10 times.
customer_reviews.text: The burner started deforming after a few uses. Works excellent otherwise. We will see what the warranty service does... I've had it for a year and a month.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Portable product
customer_reviews.text: I like the portability. I use it outside on my deck if I want to fry something and not have smoke all over the house. Brought it camping. It’s very durable. Very easy to use. I like that it comes with its own carrying case it makes it even easier to bring around.
customer_reviews.author: Aziela Cortina

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY GOT ONE!
customer_reviews.text: Finally was able to get my hands on one of these. Last year they were sold out. I live in FL and I got this to prepare for hurricane season. Tried it out with the butane cans and it worked great!! Great purchase and I love the color!
customer_reviews.author: Natasha Martinez

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Good lord is this thing cheap! It dents and cracks extremely easily
customer_reviews.author: D. Tran

customer_reviews.title: Working condition but not what was described or pictured
customer_reviews.text: I did not receive a Coleman portable burner but some other brand!
customer_reviews.author: Billie Ann

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: Works well, light weight if power goes out we are all set. Coffee, soup, eggs rice and pasta and in these times power may not be resorted soon enough
customer_reviews.author: muriel s.

customer_reviews.title: case was cracked
customer_reviews.text: the case was cracked and i did not want the hassle of returning the coffee pot. If the seller would be nice and send me a new case - i would be more than happy to change my review to 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient and helpful
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a backup option for a camping trip and had it delivered the day before. Glad I did. It rained the entire time and this was our go-to device for our meals for two days. Was able to cook pancakes, fry bacon and eggs, boil water...it works fantastically. Easy to load the butane canister, easy to light, and you can regulate the burner easily.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: LOVE MY STOVE
customer_reviews.text: Took it camping for the first time for Labor Day Weekend. This thing packed a punch! Great little thing! I would def recommend this for car camping. Super lightweight and it just works. I did see that they sell them other places for less money...so I would look for a lesser option.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Mercado

customer_reviews.title: Quality control.
customer_reviews.text: The actual burner is off center. Almost a full centimeter to the left off-center to the left in fact. I'm gonna go out on a limb here and say that this was manufactured in China? In retrospect, I would have paid a little more for a better stove.
customer_reviews.author: Gunter P.

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product. I’m a little ashamed to say this but I was a little scared of using the stove when it first arrived. Only because I read the review about one exploding. I’m so glad I got over that. It is amazing for camping! Heats up just as fast as some home cooktops, cooks evenly and consistently, lightweight and even cools down quickly for fast clean up. If you’re going somewhere and thinking I’d be nice to carry a small stove with you for warm food and drinks? Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: MF

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for camping
customer_reviews.text: Great little stove for car camping. I bought this gas stove because I’d grown tired of relying on a campfire to cook food. All I can say is that this is worth the money. It’s easy to use and heats up quickly. I’ve used it for boiling water and cooking other foods. It’s easy to clean and has a good storage box to protect it.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy54321

customer_reviews.title: mistake splurge buy
customer_reviews.text: i thought this was a match to the Propane coleman cylinders...... WARNING: this takes BUTANE and the cylinder looks like an aerosol can... currently COLEMAN is out of stock everywhere... would a substitute off brand butane work on fitting? i do not know...
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: You will not regret buying!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect in everyway, plus kids dropped on driveway (in case) and works fine. Water boils very quickly and we have used both steel pans and cast iron with no problems. Very easy to set up and use. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Love the stove.  Inexpensive but does a great job.
customer_reviews.text: We got the stove for recent camping trip and didn't realize that the butane required for it would be in short supply right now. I had to order online and stocked up for next trip. It is easy to start and has a nice even adjustable flame. The case is plastic but makes it easy to carry the stove.
customer_reviews.author: J. Holland

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves it! The instructions are clear and super easy to use. We can have it set up and ready to go in under 3 minutes. We used these fuel canisters for it and they fit nicely: Gasone Butane Fuel Canister (4pack)
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Sanchez Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little stove
customer_reviews.text: We took this stove car camping in Maine and absolutely loved it. It couldn't be lighter to transport. We've always used the mini propane stoves but this one has changed our ways. It was extremely hot, quick. Would recommend all the way! Don't forget to match the notch on your butane can to the clip on the stove. Made the mistake of trying to insert the can and leaked everywhere the first time. Once the notches are matched, you simply drop it in and lock it down.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan S

customer_reviews.title: Great lil' stove!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely loved this little one burner stove. The butane cans themselves were pretty hard to find but I was able to locate them at a bass pro shops. Otherwise I advised to buy them here and have them sent to you before well before your trip. The stove itself was easy to use and the case for store is a big plus!
customer_reviews.author: Natasha Adele

product_meta.title: Coleman Portable Butane Stove with Carrying Case
product_meta.description: On-the-go cooking just got a little easier with the Coleman Portable Butane Stove with Carrying Case. With an ultra-portable design and included carry case, this stove is ready for any camping adventure and quickly sets up on any outdoor tabletop, supporting up to a 10-inch pan. Attach an 8.8 oz. butane cylinder (sold separately), light the automatic matchless ignition with the turn of a knob, and in no time, you’re cooking with up to 7,650 BTUs of power for up to 1.25 hours. Wind baffles shield your flame from the wind, and a large stable base makes stirring easy. Use your stove for years to come thanks to an easy-to-clean, durable porcelain-coated grate, rust-proof aluminum burner, and made-to-last enameled steel exterior.
feature_bullets: Instastart ignition for matchless lighting; 7,650 total BTUs of Cooking power
Fits up to a 10 inch pan
Lasts up to 1.25 hours on high on one 8.8 ounces butane gas cylinder (sold separately)
Adjustable burner gives precise temperature control, and large base offers stability for easy stirring
Durable porcelain coated grate is easy to clean, and aluminum burner is rust proof for years of use

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
